message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss selling you this product. I believe it holds significant value for someone like you. To kick things off, I'm offering it to you for $2,000,000.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,600,000. I'm willing to pay a premium, but I'm not sure if I can go as high as $2,000,000. Can we meet in the middle?

Bob, I appreciate you coming back with an offer. It seems like we both see the value in this product.  How about we meet closer to the middle at $1,850,000? I'm confident this price reflects the true worth of what's being offered.

I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, but I'm still a bit hesitant to go that high. I'm willing to go up to $1,700,000, but I think that's the maximum I can stretch to. Can we discuss any other factors that might make the product more valuable to me?

Bob, I understand your position and I'm always happy to find ways to make a deal even better. To bridge the gap, I'm willing to include [mention a valuable add-on or service related to the product, e.g., a year of premium support, exclusive access to future updates, etc.] at no extra cost if we can agree on a price of $1,800,000.  This addition brings significant value and ensures you get the most out of your investment.

I appreciate the offer of the premium support and future updates, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to consider the offer if you can meet me at $1,650,000. I think that's a fair price for the product and the additional value you're offering.
